docs.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-17 Momentum to War Building For India and Pakistan Both countries are mounting large-scale troop buildups along the full length of their border in response to rising antagonism since a suicide attack this month on India's Parliament. India quickly blamed Pakistan and two Islamic groups operating there for the assault. Western diplomats say the mobilizations are the largest they have seen in more than a decade between the two nuclear-armed adversaries. A1 Israel vs. Arafat in Bethlehem The Palestinian leader Yasir Arafat spent the day in Ramallah despite vows that he would attend midnight Mass in Bethlehem after the Israelis barred him from attending religious observances there. To reach Bethlehem he would have had to cross Israeli checkpoints, which had special instructions in case he decided to make the trip. The Israeli government confirmed that despite having cut diplomatic contacts with Mr. Arafat, it had been secretly talking peace with his representatives. A4
